definition: generally speaking/by and large/for the most part
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to press against/to support/to prop up/to resist/to equal/to balance/to make up for/to mortgage/to arrive at/to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)

sentences.english: Most waves are caused by winds blowing over the surface of the water.
sentences.chinese: 波浪大抵都是由風吹過水麪而引起的。

sentences.english: In the aftermath of the Lehman crisis, policymakers broadly did the right thing.
sentences.chinese: 決策層在雷曼破產後的措施大抵正確。

sentences.english: Remember the navigator is current for approximately 1 week.
sentences.chinese: 記住導航儀的電力大抵能支持一個星期左右。

sentences.english: His most vaunted exploits were exposed as largely fictitious.
sentences.chinese: 他最自豪的功績，戳穿後才知大抵都是虛構的。

sentences.english: Markets for other water products are, meanwhile, mainly nonexistent.
sentences.chinese: 同樣的，其他水資源商品的市場也大抵不存在。

sentences.english: The boys' top five looks almost the same as last year.
sentences.chinese: 本年五大最受歡迎的男孩名與客歲大抵雷同。

sentences.english: But the rough semantics of what's gathered are similar.
sentences.chinese: 但所採集信息的語義大抵相似。

sentences.english: Procedure for replacing large laser jets and graph plotters is similar to that for computers.
sentences.chinese: 大型激光打印機和繪圖儀的更新程序大抵與微機相同。

definition: a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
(emphasizes that sth is precisely or exactly as stated)/precisely/exactly/even/if/just like/in the same way as
one word says it all (idiom, from Analects); to cut a long story short/in a nutshell
in general/more or less/in rough terms/basically/on the whole/overall situation/the big picture/(Tw) remains (of a dead person)
